distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for tomcat fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2020-1935: Fixed an HTTP request smuggling vulnerability (bsc#1164860).
- CVE-2020-13935: Fixed a WebSocket DoS (bsc#1174117).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: The payload length in a WebSocket frame was not correctly validated in Apache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.36, 8.5.0 to 8.5.56 and 7.0.27 to 7.0.104. Invalid payload lengths could trigger an infinite loop. Multiple requests with invalid payload lengths could lead to a denial of service.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.30, 8.5.0 to 8.5.50 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.99 the HTTP header parsing code used an approach to end-of-line parsing that allowed some invalid HTTP headers to be parsed as valid. This led to a possibility of HTTP Request Smuggling if Tomcat was located behind a reverse proxy that incorrectly handled the invalid Transfer-Encoding header in a particular manner. Such a reverse proxy is considered unlikely.
notes.title: CVE description
